title: 107_hr2310
content:
The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for uniformed services members effective January 1, 2002, based on pay grade and years of service. The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows:
- O-7: 7.3%
- O-6: 7.3%
- O-5: 7.3%
- O-4: 9.0%
- O-3: 8.3%
- O-2: 7.3%
- O-1: 7.3%
- O-10: 7.3%
- O-9: 7.3%
- O-8: 7.3% The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows:
- O-7: 7.3%
- O-6: 7.3%
- O-5: 7.3%
- O-4: 9.0%
- O-3: 8.3%
- O-2: 7.3%
- O-1: 7.3% The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows:
- O-4: 9.0%
- O-3: 8.3%
- O-2: 7.3%
- O-1: 7.3%
- O-10: 7.3%
- O-9: 7.3%
- O-8: 7.3%
- O-7: 7.3%
- O-6: 7.3%
- O-5: 7.3% The monthly basic pay percentages for commissioned officers in different ranks are as follows:
- O-4: 9.0%
- O-3: 8.3%
- O-2: 7.3%
- O-1: 7.3%
- O-9 to O-5: 7.3% Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service as an enlisted member or warrant officer have a pay grade that ranges from 7.3% to 8.3%, increasing with years of service. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service have a pay grade ranging from 7.3% to 8.3%, increasing with years of service. Commissioned officers with over 18 years of active duty service have a pay grade ranging from 8.3% to 7.3%, increasing with years of service. WARRANT OFFICERS have pay grade increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on years of service, with increments at various milestones. Warrant officers receive pay grade increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on years of service, with increments at various milestones. Warrant officers receive pay grade increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on years of service, with increments at various milestones. The pay grades for different age brackets are as follows: 7.5% for W-5, 7.5% for W-4, 8% for W-3, 8.5% for W-2, and 8.5% for W-1. Enlisted members receive pay grade increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on years of service, with increments at various milestones. Enlisted members receive pay grade increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on years of service, with increments at various milestones. The pay grade percentages are as follows: E-1 to E-6 receive 8.5%, E-7 receives 9.5%, E-8 receives 10.0%, and E-9 receives 10.5%. Enlisted members receive pay grade increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on years of service, with increments at various milestones. The pay grade percentages for each rank are as follows: E-1 to E-6 receive 8.5%, E-7 receives 9.5%, E-8 receives 10.0%, and E-9 receives 10.5%. Enlisted members receive pay grade increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on years of service, with increments at various milestones. The pay grade percentages for each rank are as follows: E-1 to E-6 receive 8.5%, E-7 receives 9.5%, E-8 receives 10.0%, and E-9 receives 10.5%. The percentages for each rank are consistent across different age brackets. Enlisted members receive pay grade increases ranging from 7.3% to 8.5% based on years of service, with increments at various milestones. The adjustment to monthly basic pay rates for uniformed services members in fiscal year 2002 required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, will not be made.
